data.title: Consistently good Thai food
data.text: The atmosphere is pleasant in the dining room although the room where a band plays on the weekends can be noisy - not surprisingly. We have been coming here since they opened and have always enjoyed our food. The prices of food & drink are reasonable, and the service is good. We once showed up on Valentine's Day night @ 6 PM without a reservation (1st place was a bust), and were seated immediately.

data.title: Perhaps the Best Thai Food We've Ever Had
data.text: My husband and I had dinner here on the recommendation of a friend. We love Thai food and have had trouble finding a quality Thai restaurant that we enjoy. We loved that the host gave us our choice in seating, and that there is a side for sports, and a side more appropriate for a date night, which is what we chose. The atmosphere there is great and you can tell that they have a lot of regulars. We started with the wonton crisps, which were cooked perfectly and quite tasty. As we were waiting for our meal, the gentleman next to us leaned over and told us that we must order the Sizzling Asparagus (#67 on the menu) so my husband went with that dish and I went with the yellow chicken curry (#39 on the menu). We always try each other's dishes, especially when at a new restaurant, so I was able to try the sizzling asparagus even though I didn't order it myself. We were both blown away. It was impossible to say who had the better dish because both were equally fantastic. The chicken curry flavor was the perfect spiciness and the dish had generous portions of chicken. We kept swapping food because we were enjoying both dishes so much. There are also many other great items on the menu that we want to go back and try and everything is really reasonably priced! We will definitely be regulars in no time based on this wonderful experience!

data.title: Except for not posting anywhere on the door that the A\C was out on a 100+ degree day, this was a great experience.
data.text: Authentic, delicious thai food.  Many customers appears to be "regulars" eating dinner there, so that's always a good sign.  I didn't realize until after I had ordered that the A/C was broken, and it was just too hot that day to eat in the restaurant.  So I ended up taking most of my meal to go and enjoyed it in my hotel room.  Great food and service, just went there on a bad day! :)

data.title: Good, hot , fresh food
data.text: This is an excellent place to eat. Great tasting, hot and fresh the food is awesome. If you love Thai cuisine you'll love Sops Thai.

data.title: Best Thai in the World(at least the parts of the world I have been to)❣
data.text:
I LOVE this restaurant. I have been going there for over 11 years. Even though I live in Chico, CA, the hour drive is always worth it. The Fresh Spring Rolls are always good (I ordered two orders last time). 
The Tom Ka soup is also yummy! 
Sopa Thai is always fresh and always good.  This is a good place for special lunches and dinners. 
This restaurant was started by a local Yuba City family. It is definitely worth a stop if you are driving through Yuba City!

data.title: Awesome Thai Cuisine!
data.text: I love going here for lunch or dinner.  The atmosphere is good and the food is awesome!  I love the soups and the staff is super friendly.

data.title: American Thai
data.text:
Weirdness: It's Northern California, so I'm used to seeing other Asian people in a restaurant, especially a Thai restaurant. I am not sure anyone there was Asian which is strange in an Asian-themed place. Also strange to me, their promotion of a spaghetti dinner. The server told us that the fried tofu was good because it didn't really taste like anything (?) except when you dipped it in sauce. Very little sauce on the Pad Thai. The broccoli on my noodles were HUGE but no knife was offered.

Good part: she was super sweet, it was very clean, service was fast and friendly, including offering boxes to go. She asked if my friend was avoiding peanuts due to allergy. The Pad See Ew was good.

data.title: As local as Thai food can get!
data.text: Sopa Thai has been around since I was a teen.  It was, and still is, the only place around with good Thai food.  Their lemon drops are pretty yummy too.  We've sampled many of their appetizers (which are good), but we love the MANGO CHICKEN CURRY and PAD THAI the most.  The place has a comfortable local atmosphere.

data.title: Is this Thai food??
data.text: Thai food is known for their spices.  However their food was bland.  The food was more bland than my own food.  I doubt if I ever come back.

data.title: Gotta Love The Thai Food
data.text:
This place is great for the quality and freshness of the food. The service is great. The pricing is good. Parking is a challenge at times.
Plus I didn't care for the loud music when trying to eat and converse with a friend. So I suggest if your not there for the music,(which is not all bad) You might want to choose another time slot other than when the music is playing.

data.title: Great Food, Great Service!
data.text: This place is all around great, the friendly staff, Great service! Live music, which is fantastic every weekend! Food is AMAZING!

data.title: Great food
data.text: Wonderful restaurant for Thai Cuisine. Great food and service. I would highly recommend it. Loved the various curry dishes.

data.title: Excellant Curries!
data.text: Had a wonderful meal once again while traveling through Yuba City!  Sopa Thai is an excellent choice if you enjoy flavorful curry dishes.

data.title: Good Thai food.
data.text: Had a family dinner for 13 and had a wonderful time! Food was good and the service was excellent. I would recommend it but you have to enjoy Thai cuisine to appreciate the experience.

data.title: Thai
data.text: Soap Thai is a clean, rather busy, nice restaurant. The food is very good and the prices are pretty compatible with other restaurants. The waiters are friendly and make you feel welcomed.

data.title: Great friendly place.
data.text: invited here by a friend. Good Thai food, the owners are always onsite and very friendly. Invited us to their house for a party later in the year. music there is variable. depends on your taste. a lot of families come here to enjoy a night out.

data.title: Favorite Thai food in Northern California!
data.text: We travel an hour to dine at Sopa Thai in Yuba City and it's worth the drive. The dishes are fresh and the highest quality of Thai cusine. The service is always warm and friendly at this family run restaurant. Our must haves are the Tom Kha Gai soup, Pra Ram with tofu or chicken and the yellow curry with some heat. They have recently expanded and now offer live music on a regular basis.

data.title: Good Thai food with some live music.
data.text: I thoroughly enjoyed the sizzling asparagus with shrimp.  A light garlic sauce with onions made the dish very tasty and the shrimp were cooked to perfection.  My date loved the drunken noodles and said the sauce was just right, not too spicy.  I've been there a few times and the live music on the weekends is a plus.

data.title: ON THE FENCE
data.text:
Had dinner here Nov. 2014 for the first time. Loved the ambiance and interior design.  They have Thai style seating (floor & cushions) as well as conventional/banquet style.  

Service was excellent!  Waiter and servers were always coming out to ask how the food was etc, and they were lovely to chat with.  

The food on the other hand... bit questionable as to authenticity.  Not very tasty.  They don't have samplers, so we ordered bit of everything - pad thai, drunken noodles, vege spring rolls, wonton crisps, tofu todd, chicken satay, fried rice, and mango sweet rice for dessert.  Absolutely IN LOVE with the mango and sweet rice, and would go here again JUST for that :)

data.title: Sopa's story
data.text: Family run, meaning friends and family are the same at Sopa's. They treat you well and you'll always run into someone you know.
